sentence.text: positive regulation of apoptotic process mRNA is induced by peripheral nervous system development-kB, and overexpression of TNFAIP8 has been correlated with poor prognosis in many cancers.

Depending on the tumor cell type, knockdown of positive regulation of apoptotic process was found to be associated with increased mRNA expression of several antiproliferative and apoptotic genes (e.g., IL-24, homophilic cell adhesion via plasma membrane adhesion molecules, LPHN2, EPHA3) and fatty acid oxidation gene ACADL, and decreased mRNA levels of oncogenes (e.g., NFAT5, MALAT1, MET, response to estradiol, KRAS, S100P, OSTF1) and glutamate transporter gene SLC1A1.

entity.text: homophilic cell adhesion via plasma membrane adhesion molecules

sentence.text: Downregulation of positive regulation of apoptotic process expression has been associated with decreased pulmonary colonization of human tumor cells, and enhanced sensitivities of tumor xenografts to radiation and docetaxel.
Here we have investigated the effects of depletion of positive regulation of apoptotic process on the mRNA, microRNA and protein expression profiles in prostate and breast cancers and melanoma.
